WorkItem.ClosedComment: We posted a fix on our end to make the data appear in the normal manner on the tooltip while wowhead fixes their database.
WorkItem.Description: In the last couple of versions Rawr's tooltips have begun to overlap text. It seems like it's mainly overlapping gems over socket bonuses. Some items show it (heroic Distant Land, non-heroic Bloodfall, all displayed gemmings of each) while others display normally. I attached a screenshot; I hope it can be seen, as I suck with image manipulation and cropping.
WorkItem.Summary: [Base] Tooltip display bug [Problem is on Wowheads end]

Comments.Message: wow that is really weird. something about that item is making it think there is no socket one but there is a socket 2 & 3 on your system.

Maybe this matters... I updated the item cache through Armory, then Wowhead, trying to get the sources updated as best as possible. I do both, in that order, since Ron told me that Armory doesn't handle socket bonuses right. Could that have something to do with it, perhaps?

It shouldn't.  And, for reference' sake, Blizzard has solved their socket bonus issues over the last six months or so, and you can generally trust the Armory to provide at least as much socket accuracy as Wowhead.
Wowhead itself has broken their data, it's the exact reason we are seeing this issue. I've sent them a message stating as such.
